measured_by: National Student Survey (NSS) – satisfaction with quality of teaching subscale
justification: The article notes that "The Complete University Guide uses the satisfaction with the quality of teaching students received in its league table," indicating that this aspect of student satisfaction is operationalised with the NSS teaching-quality subscale.

measured_by: National Student Survey (NSS) – satisfaction with feedback subscale
justification: It states that "the Guardian uses the satisfaction with the quality of teaching alongside the satisfaction with feedback subscales from the NSS in its league tables," showing that feedback satisfaction is measured through the NSS feedback subscale.

The paper explains that UK league tables are "partly based on data from the NSS. This is an annual survey completed by students in their final year," demonstrating that overall student satisfaction is gauged via the NSS.
The text describes "peer review" as "experts judging the academic quality of different universities," identifying peer-review ratings as the measurement for university academic quality.
